Abstract: This review explores the emerging field of organic electrosynthesis, focusing on the electrochemical manufacturing routes for organic chemical commodities. The integration of electrochemistry into chemical manufacturing offers a sustainable and environmentally friendly approach, aligning with global decarbonization efforts. Recent advancements in electrode materials, catalysts, and reactor designs have significantly enhanced the efficiency and selectivity of electrochemical processes. Case studies of industrially relevant organic compounds, such as alcohols, acids, and amines, are discussed, highlighting the potential for large-scale implementation. The challenges, including energy consumption and product purity, are addressed, along with strategies to overcome them. This work underscores the pivotal role of electrochemical methods in the transition towards a more sustainable and electrified chemical industry.
